title: 3 Easy Ways to Upload Video to Reddit

steps.title: Open the Reddit app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Reddit app on your phone or tablet. The app has an icon containing an orange circle with a white robot inside. There are many mobile apps that allow you to post to Reddit. This method covers Reddit's official app, which you can download from the App Store on iPhone and iPad or from the Google Play Store on Android.

steps.title: Tap the Create + icon.
steps.content: Tap the Create + icon. It's the icon with a plus (+) sign at the bottom of the screen in the center. This allows you to create a new post.

steps.title: Tap VIDEO.
steps.content: Tap VIDEO . It's the third option in the pop-up menu. Alternatively, if you want to post a link to a video from another platform , such as YouTube, copy the URL to the video and tap Link in the pop-up menu. Then tap and hold where it says "URL." Then tap Paste to paste the link.

steps.title: Select a video and tap Add.
steps.content: Select a video and tap Add . To do so, tap the video you want to upload and then tap Add in the upper-right corner. Your video should be in the MP4 or MOV format, 1GB or less, and no more than 15 minutes long. If your video is longer than 15 minutes or the wrong file format, you can edit your video using free video editing software .

steps.title: Trim the video (optional) and tap Next.
steps.content: Trim the video (optional) and tap Next . To trim the video, tap and drag the large white bars on the left or right side of the video timeline at the bottom of the screen. Tap the triangle icon to preview the video. Tap Next in the upper-right corner when you are finished trimming your video, or if you want to move on without trimming the video.

steps.title: Add a title and tap Next.
steps.content: Add a title and tap Next . You might have to trim or expand the title in the next step, according to the rules of the subreddit you're posting the video to. Tap Next in the upper-right corner when you are finished.

steps.title: Search for a community to post to.
steps.content: Search for a community to post to. To do so, use the search bar to enter the name of a subreddit or a topic related to your video. Tap the subreddit you want to post to in the search results. If you're following subreddits or communities, you'll see them listed here. You'll also be able to see which subreddits don't allow video posting.

steps.title: Edit your post according to the subreddit.
steps.content: Edit your post according to the subreddit. This means that you might need to shorten or make your "Title" longer or add tags & flair. Tap Add tags & flair if required. Universal tags can be toggled, including Not Safe for Work , Spoiler, and Brand Affiliate. You can also tap to include other tags in your post. You can only use tags from the list and cannot make your own.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . It's in the upper-right corner. This posts your video to the community you selected.

steps.title: Open https://www.reddit.com in your web browser.
steps.content: Open https://www.reddit.com in your web browser. If you're not already signed in, click LOG IN at the top-right corner to sign in.

steps.title: Navigate to a subreddit where you want to post a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a subreddit where you want to post a video. Note that you can't upload videos or images in every subreddit.

steps.title: Click Create Post.
steps.content: Click Create Post . It's under the subreddit's header with a + icon.

steps.title: Click the Images & Video tab.
steps.content: Click the Images & Video tab. You can find it at the top of the new post form. If the Images & Video tab is greyed out, you can't upload this type of media to this subreddit.

steps.title: Click the cloud with the arrow pointing up icon.
steps.content: Click the cloud with the arrow pointing up icon. This opens your file manager (File Explorer on PC and Finder on Mac) so you can browse for the video file. Alternatively, you can drag and drop your video file on top of the UPLOAD button here. This will also upload your video. Alternatively, if you want to post a link to a video from another platform , such as YouTube, copy the URL to the video. Then tap the Link tab instead of the "Images & Video" tab. Paste the link where it says "URL."

steps.title: Select your video and click Open.
steps.content: Select your video and click Open . This attaches the video to your new post. Your video should be in the MP4 or MOV format, 1GB or less, and no more than 15 minutes long. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add a title and other required info.
steps.content: Add a title and other required info. The "Title" field is at the top of the page and must be filled in. You can use up to 300 characters in the "Title" area. Click Add flair and tags if that's required information. You'll see a red asterisk next to the text if it's required. The requirements change for every subreddit, so check the rules to see what you can and cannot post. There are toggles so you can tag if your video is NSFW, contains spoilers, or if it contains a brand affiliate.

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . It's the blue button at the bottom-right corner of the post. This posts your video to the selected subreddit.

steps.title: Go to the old Reddit site here and sign in if you need to.
steps.content: Go to the old Reddit site here and sign in if you need to. You can't upload a video using the updated Reddit site on your phone or tablet's web browser. Use this method if you're using your smartphone or tablet but don't have the Reddit mobile app.

steps.title: Navigate to a subreddit where you want to post a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a subreddit where you want to post a video. Note that you can't upload videos or images in every subreddit.

steps.title: Click Submit a new link.
steps.content: Click Submit a new link . You'll see this to the far right of the page above Submit a new text post."

steps.title: Tap Choose File.
steps.content: Tap Choose File . This opens your gallery so you can pick the video you want to upload.

steps.title: Tap the video to upload.
steps.content: Tap the video to upload. The file will open in the page where you're creating a new post. Your video should be in the MP4 or MOV format, 1GB or less, and no more than 15 minutes long. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add a title and other required info.
steps.content: Add a title and other required info. The "Title" field is at the top of the page and must be filled in. If you didn't previously navigate to a subreddit where you want to post your video, you can choose one now under "Choose where to post." Tap Select under "choose a flair" if that's required information. You'll see a red asterisk next to the text if it's required. The requirements change for every subreddit, so check the rules to see what you can and cannot post.

steps.title: Tap Submit.
steps.content: Tap Submit . If this is greyed out, the video you selected hasn't finished uploading or there is an empty required field. Look over your submission again to make sure you've filled out or selected something next to every red asterisk.
